ygData.subject: Re: agil or dex?
ygData.msgSnippet: if i am not looting for the group, i am never encumbered.  my natural strength is 95 (all points went there).  plus you will often group with druids or shaman
ygData.messageBody:
if i am not looting for the group, i am never encumbered. my natural
strength is 95 (all points went there). plus you will often group with
druids or shaman who can buff your strength. plus i have all the enchancing
items. if i am group looting it doesnt matter much, i am often encumbered,
but with high level warriors, rangers, or paladins who can taunt well you
are rarely hit except in trains or bad situations.

Shada

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jesse [mailto:j@...]
> Sent: Saturday, June 26, 1999 8:17 AM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] agil or dex?
>
>
> From: Jesse <j@...>
>
>
> > i play a wood elf, the biggest advantage being that you can
> wear small or
> > medium armor. plus i like to melee, i like to play a
> battle bard, so i put
> > all of my points in to strength. with my enhancing items i
> am currently at
> > 113 strength, 102 agility, and 101 dexterity. so the
> points will come with
>
> So, how encumbered do you generally find yourself? What's your natural
> strength before magic items? I'm wondering if 90 strength
> would be a safe
> amount, when planning to wear bronze and steel plate down the road.
>
> The rest I think I'll be putting into agility, as +dex items
> are easier to
> come by.
>
> Thanks,
>
